intro: Prenanthes pendula var. erecta, commonly known as the upright bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wetlands. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
